definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil

sentences.english: Fruit-of Wudang Mountain in prestigious Ming Dynasty Wudang Mountain is the rare plant.
sentences.chinese: 武当山榔梅果在明代享有盛誉，是武当山的稀有植物。

sentences.english: In addition, Jolie was estranged from her famous father.
sentences.chinese: 此外，朱莉与她享有盛誉的父亲出现不和。

sentences.english: The company has an excellent reputation for high-quality leather shoes.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司因其生产的高质量的皮鞋而享有盛誉。

sentences.english: It wins over by its absolutely amazing, very compact aroma of matured black currants.
sentences.chinese: 绝对迷人简洁的成熟红加仑芬芳令它得享盛誉。

sentences.english: Among them, " Barkhor street" is the most prestigious one.
sentences.chinese: 其中，“八廓街”在国内外享有盛誉。

sentences.english: The sale brought Mr Axford considerable publicity.
sentences.chinese: 这一拍卖为埃克斯福特先生带来盛誉。

sentences.english: The Lord of the Rings, a three volume fantasy adventure epic authored by J. R.
sentences.chinese: 《魔戒》，三卷奇幻史诗巨著，作者是享有盛誉的J。

sentences.english: My school has long been enjoying a high reputation, and I have profited much from it.
sentences.chinese: 我的学校久已享有盛誉了，我由它得益很多。

sentences.english: He received recognition from both national and international bodies in the field of Tourism Economics.
sentences.chinese: 黄博士在马来西亚国内和国际旅游经济领域享有盛誉。

sentences.english: Miu Yue was a famous critic in the research of Ci in the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 缪钺先生是20世纪享有盛誉的词学家。

sentences.english: He also has long enjoyed a reputation as being hugely charming andseductive.
sentences.chinese: 迷人和性感这样的盛誉他也已经享有很久了。

sentences.english: He is the rare businessman with legitimate worldwide celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是少数几个在全世界都享有盛誉的商人。

sentences.english: The occupancy of domestic market comes up to more than 30%.
sentences.chinese: “飞龙”牌运动护具，在国内外市场享有很高盛誉。

sentences.english: It has enjoyed good reputation in Europe market.
sentences.chinese: 它们在欧洲市场已经享有盛誉。

sentences.english: As you see， our products are enjoying a good reputation all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 如你们所知，我们的产品在世界各地享有盛誉。

sentences.english: The Mournes are internationally renowned for their picturesque scenery.
sentences.chinese: 莫恩山脉如画的景色在国际上享受盛誉。

definition: to acclaim/to sing the praises of
to make a name/to become famous
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
to be famous far and wide (idiom)
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to dub with a nice-sounding appellation/fanciful moniker
